page.title: 13 LOWER APPERLEY
page.content: Lower Apperley has more amenties than The Leigh. It is situated just to the north of the B.4213 road and has a good bus service run by a private company called Swanbrook. There are 7 buses daily in each direction between Tewkesbury and Gloucester via the Haw Bridge over the River Severn. In spite of this, some houses had 2 cars. There were 3 post boxes and 2 telephone kiosks in the area and a Methodist chapel and a pub called The Farmers Arms. There were 2 more public houses opposite each other at the western end of the Haw Bridge. In the village of Apperley a kilometre to the north there is a Post Office/stores and a village hall/community centre with regular local activities; dancing classes,Brownies and a youth club. .
